result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A. Mackey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, On or Near a School, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, On or Near a School, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>50g) [Modifiers: On or Near a School, Second or Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to 16CF150.  Credit for 647 days served.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with anyone who deals or uses drugs, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Ct.1 and 16CF150.  Credit for 647 days served.
CONSECUTIVE to Cts.1&3 and 16CF150.  No credit due on Ct.5.

Sentencing Hearing 2/23/17
Cts.2,4,6,7, and 8 - Dismissed & read in  kmk
Presentence incarceration credit.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 10 years WSP concurrent to 16CF150:  5 year initial confinement w/credit for 647 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 3 the court imposes a total sentence of 10 years WSP concurrent to ct 1 and 16CF150:  5 years initial confinement w/credit for 647 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 5 the court imposes a total sentence of 20 years WSP consecutive to cts 1 & 3 and 16CF150:  10 years initial confinement; 10 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; deft to pay $750 DNA surcharge.  No contact with drug users/dealers.

*** REVOKED BOND ***
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No drug paraphernalia.
